CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. 5, reads: "Max Roach Crew Joins NAACP - During their current engagement at Crawford Grill, 2, Max Roach, intrepid and progressive drummer, and his combo signed for NAACP memberships with the local branch this year. Each musician took a $10 membership, with Roach taking one for his wife, Mildred, his son, Darryl, 9, and himself.  Matthew Moore, local NAACP board member and one of the top membership producers, shakes hands with the master percussionist, following the Roach crew's signing of their application blanks.  Left to right: Booker Little, trumpet; Moore, Roach, George Coleman, tenor sax; Art Davis, bass, and Julian Priester, trombone. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men, including members of Max Roach's band from left: Booker Little, Pittsburgh NAACP board member Matthew Moore, Max Roach, George Coleman, Art Davis, Julian Priester, posed in Crawford Grill No. 2
